intro: Biophytum hermannii, commonly known as the Hermann's ice plant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and unique adaptations to arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are thick and succulent, storing water to help it survive in dry conditions. Biophytum hermannii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
